intro: Sauvagesia sprengelii var. riobranquensis, commonly known as the Cape chestnut, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to South Africa. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces small, round fruits that turn red when mature, containing a single seed. This species is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
